website_summaries.verdict: These are an inexpensive alternative to brand name diaper pail refill bags for several different pails, making them a great value.
pros: Bags are made of sturdy material that does a decent job masking odor
Compatible with Diaper Genie models, Munchkin Step, and Pail models
Each bag fits 270 newborn diapers, bags have impressive capacity
cons: Material is semi-translucent, which can be unpleasant to look at when taking trash out

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you have diaper genie
customer_reviews.text: The plastic seems sub par to original diaper genie. But does the work.
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv Garg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this brand!! I bought these to try and save a few dollars as the Playex brand is a little more expensive. These are very flimsy and do not block any of the smell out. You walk into the room and smell dirty diapers. I ended up throwing them out and spending the money on the Platex brand.
customer_reviews.author: A You

customer_reviews.title: ATTN PLZ READ
customer_reviews.text: Idk why all the bad reviews but these bags work the same as the diaper genie brand, I ain't going back. I recommend for anyone with a diaper genie complete. The lid stays closed & the plastic is the same quality as the name brand. If your having odor problems or bag ripping which hasn't happened to me, then simply change the bags out daily. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: but saw that these were cheaper and since the Target one were fine we'd try these
customer_reviews.text: We tried these for our Playtex Diaper Ginnie. I have tried the Target brand, but saw that these were cheaper and since the Target one were fine we'd try these. Unfortunately they are TOO cheap. They fit fine, but with a 18 month old who has smelly pooh they do no do a good job sealing in the stink. We have since stored them for when we have another little one with less stink. If you have an infant who has not switched to food these will work fine, but once you introduce food and things begin to stink, beware.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: BUYERS BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE....DO NOT BUY!!!! I have tried many off brand diaper pail refills and these are by far the WORST!!! It does nothing for the smell and it rips almost everytime I take it out leaving dirty diapers for me to pick up. I would rather just throw the diapers in the regular trash instead of using these bags.
customer_reviews.author: Georgette Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Definitely my new "go to" for diaper pail refills. Doesnt mask the smell as good as the Diaper Genie brand.
customer_reviews.text: I chose to purchase these as a cheap alternative to the Diaper Genie brand. I definitely will purchase these again! Definitely my new go to when it comes to diaper pail refills. Although, the odor control is not as good as the Diaper Genie brand (which is the only other brand I have tried) I don't have a problem with that because I empty out the dirty diapers about every 4/5 days. They also seem a lot more thin than the Diaper Genie brand but so far I have not had any problems with tearing. Definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a cheaper alternative.
customer_reviews.author: JRichards

customer_reviews.title: COMPATIBLE WITH MUNCHKIN PAIL - KEEP THE ODOR LOCKED IN
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect with my Munchkin diaper pail. Plastic is sturdy and doesn’t break, it definitely KEEPS THE ODOR LOCKED IN. You know how some bags leak the stench out? This one doesn’t, odor is locked in. I wish I went with diaper Genie instead Munchkin but lesson learned. They are not scented. These bags are the best value, I am coupon manic and calculate price to cents, no better deal than this one especially if you subscribe and save (5 items per delivery) you get additional 15% off!
customer_reviews.author: La Vida Loca

customer_reviews.title: Put to the test. Passed with flying colors!
customer_reviews.text: I read lots of reviews and compared products. The name brand products have the same ratio of unhappy people. With that, I decided to try this product because the price was good. (Plus seller is standing by product and offering a full refund if unhappy). I received my shipment and took out my target brand (just in case). The bags are VERY strong. I even did a test once filled to see durability once full. I yanked it out of the genie, tied it and threw it down the hall.... not a single tear. Odor control is great as well! I will happily keep using this product and recommending to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! We use the Munchkin Arm and Hammer diaper pail and these fit perfectly! The only con is that they do not mask the smell as good as the Arm and Hammer bags when you open up the pail to dispose of a diaper but it’s not intolerable and it’s only when it’s opened. Other than that, they’re sturdy and get the job done. They’re also almost half the price! Great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff! I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I ran out of diaper genie refills. After running low I went to go purchase more and the price of the diaper genie brand is ridiculous. After some research and reading reviews, I went with these. Let me preface this by saying that the diaper genie brand let out some stinky-ness after dropping in a diaper and these are about the same (not better or worse). I had no problem finding the beginning to feed through to the bottom so for the price and comparibility to the other brand, I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Megs44146

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Plastic - Doesn’t work right in Diaper Genie (at least for me)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several times to use these and... they’re just not working for me. Each time I stick a diaper in more and more plastic comes out at and the end when it’s filled I’m left with so much excess unused plastic I’m forced to be resourceful and figure out how I can use what is left. I’ve put a photo of what my super lovely cr*p train looks like by the time it’s “full”. It’s really irritating and I’m not sure why this happens?
customer_reviews.author: nandakap

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t function as well as brand name
customer_reviews.text: The price is great compared to the diaper genie brand. The plastic quality is quite good and have had no tears etc. My issue is that every time I add a diaper, a little bit of the plastic bag from the main orange ring goes into the diaper pail. You keep adding diapers and after a few days another 8-12inches of plastic bag has entered the bin. Which is very wasteful and more than offsets any costs savings I think. Maybe it’s just my type of pail but just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: D. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: All this time I was installing the refills the wrong way!!!
customer_reviews.text: These refills by ChoiceRefill works perfectly!! I feel kinda shameful that I was installing it totally in the wrong way!! PLEASE CHECK the instructions on the refills, I didn’t look at the arrow and failed to install the product in the right way!! This is very important since I just read reviews telling this product was not compatible with the Genie basket. Totally the opposite. The value is great and also the quality!! I’m happy that I got to figure out the right way!! No more smelly diapers out!!
customer_reviews.author: Tere

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This works on the Munchkin Diaper Pail and so glad it does! Price point is where it needs to be as baby tend to make a lot of messes in the first fews years. Bags are thick and sturdy. I haven't had any issues with tearing. One takeaway the bags to do not hold in the smell for long. After 5-7 days you can sometimes smell the older diapers in the pail. Otherwise this is a great alternative to the major brands. My only wish is that companies find a way visually to let you know when it's time to refill.
customer_reviews.author: R. P.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute garbage. Pun intended. First pack worked just great and I thought I found my new go to for the diaper genie but then every pack after that has worked out horribly.... Every time you put a diaper in it, the diaper "catches" in such a way that you have to loosen more and more trash bag from the ring until you have this WAD of wasted trash bag space as demonstrated in my picture. What a hassle. Doesn't function as intended. Rather pay more for the name brand which functions as it should.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, they allow the smell to come out!
customer_reviews.text: This review will be a lot similar to that from A, it is ridiculous how much amazon allows for bad products to be sold on their website don’t buy these, they are cheap and crappy. 1) they let the smell come out, so yes the room smells like dirty diapers (prepare to take the diapers out daily) 2) once they ran out they snap out, therefore you have to throw a part of bags away 3) they’re thin yet they get stuck in the bag cutter the diaper genie has In summary avoid at all costs, I would have given it 0 stars is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Luis P. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible replacement to Playtex originals. We’ve used the playtex brand for years and decided to try these since they were less money. They’re cheaply made, super thin, break easily, and the diaper smell permiates these bags so the room smells worse than when you use the original manufacturer brand. Don’t be fooled, these may look like diaper genies but they sure don’t act like them. Bad product. Look elsewhere and save your money. Buyer beware. Don’t buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Hated them. We have the Diaper Genie expression and it just doesn’t work with it. The bag will not feed correctly and it just didn’t work as the name brand does. We didn’t notice any smell but we had a hard time getting these to function how they should. It’s like the opening is just too big so you have more bag flowing (without much resistance) into the bin than what you’re needing. You end up wasting a lot of product
customer_reviews.author: TwinMomma

customer_reviews.title: Diaper pale doesn't close well with these
customer_reviews.text: We have a Diaper Genie and have never had an issue with its inner "flaps" closing after putting a diaper in it. When we got these (because Amazon auto-ship is so handy!) suddenly the flaps weren't closing and thus the diaper smell would continually stink up the room. You have to open the case and pull the bag down repeatedly (until it's full, so maybe 1-3 times) to give it more slack so that it doesn't hold the flaps open. I don't know if it's some kind of user error, but since our baby is 18 mos old and we've been using the Genie this whole time, I'm thinking it's the liners.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Milne

customer_reviews.title: Quality since 2 years has deteriorated to flimsy delicate material that can tear even with fingers.
customer_reviews.text: I've been ordering these since 2 years for our first kid, and now using for our second. I liked the thick material and odor blocking material and had this on 2 month subscription. The quality has been great for almost 2 years but the latest one I got this month was very flimsy almost like it can get punctured by even finger nails, when replacing or putting in a new one. I will be canceling the subscription and look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: JustADad

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as before
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered these before and they were great. This order just arrived today. I went to install it in my sons diaper genie and realized that they’ve changed the plastic cartridge that the bags come in. It’s a flimsy plastic with a removable lid. I wasted about 8 feet of the bag just getting this thing installed. I have a toddler and a newborn and have zero time or tolerance for things that chew up more time than they should. If I hadn’t already destroyed the first pack of these (they came as a 4 pack) I’d send them back. I won’t be ordering this brand again and doubt I’ll even mess around with using the remaining 3 packs.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity Grant

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t trap the odor!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well I’ll start off by mentioning I have bought off brands before and never had an issue. However, with this particular brand I do. Arrived well packaged in a set of 4. I noticed on my first use with it that it fit the dispenser and looked nicer then the other brands I have purchase. These do not lock in the nasty smell of the diapers! Even as I open the diaper dispenser to throw another diaper as soon as I open it it stinks and it’s STRONG. Not worth your money if the smell is coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Gamez4

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: We originally had the Diaper Genie brand bags but I didn't want to keep paying for those when we ran out. This brand has been a great value for the price. Just as sturdy, lasts just as long, only thing is there's no real scent that I notice... But that doesn't make much of a difference to me because I never felt the diaper genie brand scent covered up the poop odor when you opened up the actual diaper genie. We're pleased with these and have now had them on subscription for many months. Wouldn't bother going back to Diaper Genie brand, too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have bought both this and the diaper genie brand refills, and alternated them a couple times, and you get more with these than with diaper genie brand and its basically the same. product I will agree that the plastic of the bags is thinner, but I have never had a case that the bag ruptured, and I liked to pack the diapers in pretty tight. Also I saw some one said that the lid doesn't close, it closes just fine for us, and even if it's slightly ajar it doesn't let out any more odor than if it was sealed tight.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Giampa

customer_reviews.title: Best cost
customer_reviews.text: So much more cost effective than arm and hammer brand. Bags are a little thinner but get the job done. We tried another brand for a while but the scent made me gag - these are unsented which I prefer. We don't put poopy diapers in here since he's been on solids (none of the bags can contain that smell completely). Took 1 star away since the bags sometimes get twisted and pull out more bag than you need, resulting in large sections of unused bag. I just push diapers down, and knot way low to still use all of it. Have been using these for a while and will continue with my 2nd.
customer_reviews.author: rosie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Stick to Target brand or Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try these and I didn't like them. You are better off buying target brand or the actual diaper genie brand. These refills seemed thin and would get stuck by not releasing enough when throwing a dirty diaper away. In turn, this would cause the lid to stay open a bit and make the whole room smell! Kind of pointless to have to open it up and manually have to pull the bag down to make sure it continues to gain slack and not stay open to stink up a room.
customer_reviews.author: Ali17

customer_reviews.title: Purchase these!! You won’t regret it!!
customer_reviews.text: We recently picked up a diaper genie second hand. At first I was hesitant to purchase one because I’ve heard the bags can get very expensive over time but I found these bags and definitely won’t be using the diaper genie or any other expensive name brand bags. These work great, they are super thick so they hold in the smells (atleast the smell of my breast fed 6 month old l) I will definitely be repurchasing these and recommending them to my other mom friends!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: They are thick and fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Not sure what people are talking about. They are very thick and fit perfectly in my diaper genie. My genie closes all the way locking in the yucky smells. They are a great alternative to the brand name liners. I just bought more because they work so well. I’m so happy I found a cheaper pale liner that does the job. I hated paying a lot of money for something I’m literally throwing away. I suggest everyone to give these a try!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Plastic getting pulled down too much.
customer_reviews.text: The material is great; however, for whatever reason the plastic kept getting pulled down so when I take it out to throw away (even when I started short). It’s a waste in my opinion as I’m basically throwing the plastic that’s not used.
customer_reviews.author: amazon86

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT MUNCHKIN PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: I did not notice a scent to them at all as they seem unscented. They fit the actual Elite Diaper Genie but NOT the 2 Munchkin brands listed in the descriptions. Was disappointed in that but ended up purchasing a second hand Elite DG anyway. The thickness seems good but have yet to see how it holds up smells. Will update review once using.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Ohman

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit in brand name diaper genie.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of $. The ring doesn't sit right in the top of the diaper genie. We've used the Diaper Genie brand for 6 years with no issues. Thought I'd save some money and order this off brand, however, they don't fit correctly, and the lid of the genie won't close and is constantly stinky, so we haven't been using the genie because I can't bring myself to spend even more for the name brand ones and spending almost as much on these. Just doing the old-fashioned way--plastic grocery bag tied tightly. WILL NOT BE REORDERING THIS BRAND AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Huey

customer_reviews.title: No need to buy the overpriced originals
customer_reviews.text: The plastic material truly is impermeable to any kind of smell. The geek in me had to test it: I put fresh dog poop directly into a piece of liner and tied it up. My nose could only feel the warmth but no smell whatsoever. In conclusion, if your pail works properly and you don’t keep it open for more than needed when throwing diapers away, you won’t have any smell issues. You won’t even need the charcoal odor absorbers.
customer_reviews.author: Felix and Diana

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST for solving this annoying problem:
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand of diaper pail refills I will ever use moving forward. Have you ever opened a brand new (name brand) refill, started to pull out the bag, and then realize you didn’t grab the end and have to PULL and PULL and waste product until you find the end of the bag? Not sure if I explained that great, but if you know, you know. Well, these refills have a STICKER to show you where the end is and where to start pulling from, completely eliminating the problem. In my experience, they stop odors and are as strong as the name brand refills at a fraction of the cost. You will absolutely love these.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but Stinky
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this bags are a great value and last a long time BUT they do not cover up the scent of stinky diapers and I wish I had known that before purchasing them. I came home and my whole house smelled like diapers due to the bags not being able to hold the smell of a day old diaper. That was a disappointment. I do appreciate how there is a good amount of bag in each tube that lasts awhile, just wish the quality was better.
customer_reviews.author: Katie B

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: These are very affordable and useful. I use them for my munchkin diaper pail and they fit perfect. My only complaint is sometimes too much bag gets pulled down into the pail, so when I empty out the diapers I have to reinsert some excess bag back into the dispenser thing, and I with they were scented like the individual munchkin diaper disposal bags that I carry in my diaper bag. Other than that I like these and will continue my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Paty

customer_reviews.title: Works great, cheaper than Diaper Genie brand. Win-Win!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Works great with the Diaper Genie and is cheaper than the name-brand product. It's a win win! The only thing I can think of against it is that it claims you can fit x-amount of dirty diapers in there and I do NOT agree with whatever the astronomical number is. I'd say you can fit 1/3 of the number they claim. But no big deal, just a bit of false advertisement on their part. Oh well! NOTE: if you found this review to be helpful, please click HELPFUL below!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Good as the name brand just more cost efficient
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about purchasing these with all the reviews back and forth. I took a chance since it’s a great deal. They fit perfect in our Diaper Genie. The plastic is a bit thicker in my opinion. We are super pleased! No smell, no rips or tears. We are very happy and will order again. I hope this review helps you too
customer_reviews.author: Kimama Bangsi

customer_reviews.title: Great value and has worked for us well!
customer_reviews.text: These work just as well for me as the name brand, to be honest. I must say that I have an infant not on solids yet, so I can’t speak to the smells as my kiddo’s diapers don’t smell that horrible yet. However, I have not had any issues with ripping and it seems to do just as good of a job as the more expensive stuff so it’s good enough for us and a great way of saving precious money needed for other baby stuff, in my books!
customer_reviews.author: HMJ

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as name brand
customer_reviews.text: I would be absolutely lost without my diaper genie. It gets expensive always buying name brand things, and there are so many competitors doing it at a fraction of the price. I honestly cannot tell the difference between these and the name brand ones(but my wallet does). Sometimes I get a little annoyed because the sticker that indicates where you pull out the bag can be placed in the wrong spot, and then it takes forever to figure out where the bag starts. But other than that i have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: jennys

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these but they just didn’t work for me. The Smell leaks out of everytime you open and change the bags. They smell leaked onto our diaper genie. The bags fall out of the tube when you add diapers in. I prefer the mama bear but those sold out because of the pandemic. I tried these twice and will not purchase again. They do the job so if you’re tight for money these might work for you but I don’t recommend unless you really need to.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Other brands hold off odors better
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought the mama bear brand, these showed up for a cheaper price. However, I have found they do not lock the scent of 10 month old baby poo out like the other brand. The mama bear brand raise their price which is unfortunate, however I wouldn't purchase this brand again for the simple fact that it does not so as good of job keeping odors away. I will look into other brands or stick with mama bear.
customer_reviews.author: TammyLou

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could attach a "smell" instead of a photo.
customer_reviews.text: I am normally pretty excited to buy a dupe product and even if it's a little sub-par to the brand name, I give it credit for what its worth. THIS IS NOT WORTH THE $5 YOU SAVE. They DO NOT seal in smell like the Diaper Genie brand do (and do so WELL) and they are flimsy. You might as well throw your kids poo diapers in the regular trash with the smell these will release. I still have 2 rolls left and they are so bad I am tempted to throw them out and just buy the regular refills.
customer_reviews.author: SarBar

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and smelly...Just pay for actual brand bags
customer_reviews.text: I have the munchkin pail and have been using the Arm & Hammer brand refill bags for a year. The first day I switched to these cheaper bags the entire nursery smelled like dirty diapers and I had to open the windows. Just pay for the brand pail bags and save yourself the hassle. The bag also rips easily and even in our outdoor garbage cans you can smell the diapers in these cheap bags. So gross.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Compatible but not comparable
customer_reviews.text: So these bags are a cheaper alternative to the diaper genie brand refills and are completely compatible with the diaper genie BUT quality wise not so great. The smell is awful. They do not contain the smell even half as well as the diaper genie brand bags. I can smell if first thing in the morning even when it hasn't been opened in 10-12 hours and when you do open it, ugh forget it, so putrid. I gave it a try but definitely going back to the diaper genie brand, these bags defeat the purpose of the diaper genie in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: They work but are thinner and don't block smell as well
customer_reviews.text: They work ok, but I'm going to stick with the original as these ones are thinner and it tore already. They also don't seem to hold out the oder as well either. When installing them in the unit the package these are in are lighter and slightly a different shape. They do fit in the top thing but they fit loose and when putting new bag in I had to reach up from the bottom to pull it through as they didn't seem as stiff as the others to fall through the openings.
customer_reviews.author: BAM BAM

customer_reviews.title: Very worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this brand for a little over a year and a half and they're great! Traps the bad scents very well, very durable. With my long time use of this brand, I've only had a bag rip *once* and it was mainly my fault because I cought it on a really sharp objects, didn't realize, and pulled really hard 😂 so I don't really blame the product, just my stupidity. Great value and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using a diaper genie since our 19m old was a newborn, and looking at different brands of refills. We were frequently disappointed and generally went back to the name brand. We tried this one on a whim, and found a new favorite. With the sticker on the edge, it’s easy to use and easy to put in. It’s a more durable plastic than then diaper genie brand (because we all hate those occasional and oh so foul bag blowouts), making it a staple in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan H

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to buying the more expensive name brand. I found them to be able to hold more and smell less. With other brands whenever I used to put a diaper in it would pull extra bag down and cause me to run out faster. This design is much easier and I didn't have that same issue so I got more use! Let's be real, for basically being plastic that holds poop... it does the job!!
customer_reviews.author: Shivonne T

customer_reviews.title: Better off getting store brand refills
customer_reviews.text: These refills did not work well at all with my Diaper Genie expressions pail. The bag comes out more than the name or store brand refills when inserting a soiled diaper into the pail. It also twists which causes more of the bag to come out. By the time I check the pail to dispose of it in the garbage dumpster there is an excess of twice the length of the diapers. Wouldn’t recommend these refills with my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the brand name ones.
customer_reviews.text: These should be close to the brand name ones, but really don't work as well. When you put a diaper in, the weight of the diaper should be enough to extend the bag down - gravity is supposed to help the soiled stuff settle to the bottom of the can. Unfortunately, the way the plastic bag material is packed prevents it from settling. This means that you have to stick your hand down far into the can. Ick. I will buy the name brand ones in the future.
customer_reviews.author: TKPFB

customer_reviews.title: Dont be stupid these are worth the money if you use correctly
customer_reviews.text: Okay is everyone who buys and hates these stupid I noticed alot of pictures with the entire bag in tact it's like foil you cut it to the length you need when my genie is full I trim it with the built in blade ( if you dont have one grab some scissors) and push out all the air and tie it up simple as that yall are wasting the plastic by only using it for a couple diapers -_- these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Product inconsistency
customer_reviews.text: We ordered and received 2 separate boxes of the diaper pail refills. The first box was terrible. The refills were thin, light blue, and blocked no scent whatsoever. The second box was thicker, bright blue, and was better at blocking the scent. Product control and quality is definitely questionable with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: summ10er

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy plastic ring and thick plastic liner. Lasts just as long as any other brand refill I’ve purchased. The bag itself has no discernible scent and seemed to do just as well as containing scent as other refills. Only downside is, the thickness of the ring and the liner are a little overkill but that wouldn’t prevent me from buying these refills again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette M

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Affordable option for my Munchkin diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: I have a munchkin diaper pail and these are the only off brand liners that work, for me! They are affordable and work well! Other off brand or generative were too tall for my munchkin pail. These are the right size and dispense properly. They are a little thinner than the Munchkin brand but I’ve had minimal issues with breaking. This is my second or third order and I’m definitely a customer for the duration of the diaper years!
customer_reviews.author: Amazin_Grace

customer_reviews.title: Just as good quality, and more compact.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a cheaper alternative from the diaper genie brand for my diaper genie. They fit great, and are actually a bit more compact overall. Bags are just as good quality and I will be making the switch and subscribing to these bags going forward. Plus, you get 4 in a package instead of 3! Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: less expensive, just as good as name brand product
customer_reviews.text: These plastic liners fit the diaper genie elite product perfectly. It's excellent to have an off-brand to substitute for a lower price. Between this product and the name brand liners, I don't notice any difference in the plastic liner smell or thickness. They seem the same, just less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, minor drawback.
customer_reviews.text: The stinky diaper smells come through the plastic a little unlike the diaper genie original bags. It isn’t horrible but enough to attract gnats/flies in the garage while waiting for trash day. This doesn’t happen with the diaper genie bags. This is my fifth baby and my first time using anything other than the original. Once you’ve got that many kids you need to pinch pennies somewhere overall is is quite worth the savings honestly. The gnats go away after trash day and there really isn’t any other difference. Just as strong and durable as well as holding I believe slightly more diapers per length than diaper genie (the material is slightly wider)
customer_reviews.author: Yasmeen K.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Contain Scent
customer_reviews.text: These do not contain scent and when I utilize the cutting tool to remove the bag from the Diaper Genie the bag shreds and leaves little blue slivers everywhere, we switched back to our preferred brand and do not have the shredding problem which rules out issues with the cutting tool or my “technique”. Disappointed and will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Anniebell Marie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try to save money, you’ll regret it
customer_reviews.text: They “work” fine as far as installing in the Diaper Genie and holding diapers. However, they do nothing for the smell and I gag every time I open the diaper genie! It’s worth it to go name brand here. I have an entire unopened box to throw out because I can’t stand the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Courtney Walkenhorst

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Keep the Smell In!
customer_reviews.text: I usually am not a name brand shopper; always hunt for deals! I love the Mama Bear diaper genie refills! But I bought these once and my son's room stinks like baby poo like never before. I actually gave away the other 3 of these because I can't stand to use them. I would not recommend these unless you have the scent refills. Otherwise though they work the same as the original bags.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis K. Herberg

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how thick the bag is
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my first refills and are currently using them in a diaper genie elite. When I opened the first one I like the “start here” sticker. It was placed correctly and was able to start the bag easily. I know they can be placed incorrectly sometimes but I haven’t had that yet. The bag also is thicker than the off brand ones I was using before so that a bonus! I have 3 in diapers/pull-ups so lots of stink and these thicker bags contain it pretty well. I’m very happy with these and will definitely be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!! I will be buying these again and again.
customer_reviews.text: I think these are better than diapers genie brand. It feels thicker and it hasn't ripped at all yet down the side like the diaper genie bags sometimes do. It holds a whole lotta diapers as well. This is the only brand I will be buying for my diaper pail from now on! It also has a start here sticker when you take off the top so you know where the exact start of the plastic is.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Danesky

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have never purchased any brand other than the genie brand and decided to give these a try. So far they are doing well with the smell which is the main thing but the bag doesn’t seem to slide down as well when you put the diaper in. Almost too thick it seems. Other than that...no complaints. Will likely continue to buy as they are at a better price point!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Craft

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend these bags
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It is cheaper and it does fit the genie brand that I have at my moms. At home I have a Munchkin so hopefully it fits as well.. With 2 newborns, one ring last us 1 month. Im talking like 7 to 8 diapers a day (approx) Hopefully the video helps.. i stop it by mistake when i was about to tie up the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: I will not buy them again and I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like it at all, although the bag is thick and looks strong, the bag comes out of the round plastic that holds it every time you insert a dirty diaper and the bag is lost and does not work at all, a bag pack lasts me for just 2 times and I have to put in another new cartridge. For this reason I will not buy them again and I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: lorena Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Better than diaper genie cartridges!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, waaaay easier to use than diaper genie and they are a better value! They have a little sticker that guides you where to pull from which I found helpful since I always pull from the wrong place on the diaper genie ones which made them all screwed up the whole time you’re pulling them down ugh! These are so much better and cheaper!!
customer_reviews.author: Keiko Gannaway

customer_reviews.title: MY ENTIRE HOUSE STINKS. YUCK!
customer_reviews.text: The smell! We change our bags about every 3 days and have a diaper genie. There was never a smell before I tried these. These DO NOT block any smells. Our entire house smells like dirty diapers. These are garbage. Just pay a few more dollars for the diaper genie ones. I came on here to order the real ones and get a refund on these.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Saves money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter in law and she likes them. She says they fit great with the diaper genie and do what they are supposed to do. Her rating of 3 for durability is based on if you fill them too full, the bag will break on you. These bags do cost less than the systems refill bags which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: A good generic bag for Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: Good generic bags for a Diaper Genie. We bought the Genie for our garage. Yes, our garage. It's for the doggy poop bags when we get home from walks. The Genie works wonderfully to abate the smell in the summer! These bags are just fine but they are a bit thinner than the other generic bags. I bought these because Amazon was out of the ones I usually purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Beth G, An Opinionated Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Thick but smelly
customer_reviews.text: The bags are great...but it does NOTHING for the order control. 🤢 my two year olds room smells like a dirty diaper. So for every 💩 diaper we have to change the bags...NOT COOL.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Horrible bags
customer_reviews.text: Horrible bags that don’t contain the smell whatsoever. Don’t recommend buying these. The Target brand is MUCH better and fits in all diaper genies.
customer_reviews.author: lantonuccio

customer_reviews.title: okay substitute for Diaper Genie bags
customer_reviews.text: I could not figure out for the life of me why my child's diapers smelled so bad every time I disposed of a new one in the Diaper Genie. Note, this only happens when you open the Diaper Genie. After it is closed the smell starts to go away. These bags do not mask the smell as well as the name brand. If you don't mind the stinky smell lingering for a few extra moments then these might be worth your money. I have ordered these several times but to be honest, am going to try Arm & Hammer instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brand. Diaper genie version is just too expensive for such a small quantity. This pack included 4 discs and cost was $16. This really does compare to diaper genie's brand. Before I've tried "Mama Bear" and was far less superior than this brand. In comparison with mama bear - This brand blocks the smell and the plastic is a lot thicker. It's also easy to install. I will purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Missy2beTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for price!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a diaper genie. The cost is great. I even have a subscription. No smell. The only complaint I have is that everytime I push a new diaper in it pushes more of the plastic bag down with it. By the time it feels full and I go to change the bag I open the lid and there’s a bag of dirty diapers 6 feet long. I guess this shouldn’t be a complaint since I’m not changing the bag as often as I would if I used the genie diaper brand. The bags do contain diaper smell.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Does not save money; a lot of wasted product
customer_reviews.text: When I would open our Diaper Genie to take out the diapers, I would see that about 3/4 of the plastic in the bottom was waste. Wayyyyy more bag was being dispensed with each use than necessary. I thought it was maybe a fluke in the first one we tried, but every refill has been this way. Unlike some of the other reviewers, I thought it held the smell fine. I have gone back to Diaper Genie brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Sue Martin

customer_reviews.title: Got 3 uses out of one refill, terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible bags. They come out so easily that by the time you fill one up, you have 4 uses worth of plastic bag that you have to either throw away or play with it until you can reuse some of it. Then it continues to come out excessively every time you put a diaper into the pail. Not worth the money, and definitely not a convenient solution to diaper stinkage, although I will say you cannot smell the diapers outside of the pail. So at least one thing worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Santa Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Saving money is not always worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these instead of paying more money for the name brand ones. My mistake for trying to save money. The smell from my daughter's diapers were so bad. I cleaned the diaper genie with bleach just in case it was something else and still anytime there were diapers in the bag portion it did not contain the smell. I have gotten these before and did not have the same problem. Not sure if they changed how they were made. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Not diaper genie compatible
customer_reviews.text: These bags suck. I was cheap and didn’t want to spend the money on the actual diaper genie refills. Generic isn’t always compatible. The ring for the bag is too small, of you force the ring on you can’t pull down the bag. If you want to get out the bags then the lid to the pail doesn’t close. Skip this product and spend the money on actual Diaper Genie refills.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Generic Brand for my Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: Off brand so it's cheaper but works well with the diaper genie. Even has a little tab when you open to help you start the bag which other off brands don't (i've completely ruined 1 from a different brand trying to start the bag). Doesn't have a smell, which also means it doesn't exactly trap the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pajerowski

customer_reviews.title: Best aftermarket bags I've bought so far.
customer_reviews.text: The ring fits perfectly in the unit! I've found with other brands that's not always the case and that lets the stinky escape. I don't notice a sent which i like. the last brand had a light baby powder scent which i thought id like but you could smell it even with the lid closed. The bags are also much thicker than any other I've purchased in the past. Ill be sticking with these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Seyfried

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep the smell in
customer_reviews.text: I really like how easy these are to use. But I feel like they don't hold in the smell at all! We've been having to put the whole trash can outside and air out the nursery because of how bad it gets. The point of these and the diaper genie are to keep in the smell! I might as well use a regular trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Orth

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a diaper genie and these are compatible with mine! I give this product a 5 star rating. Honestly, these bags are thicker and more durable than the actual diaper genie brand and cheaper which is great. I gave a 3 star for scent because it doesn't really have a scent However, it doesnt allow the smell of diapers escape so im pleased. Ill be ordering these for now on isntead of getting the brand name ones that are nearly 5 dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Kaylor

customer_reviews.title: Works but doesn’t hold stink in very well
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the cheapest Diaper Genie refill out there! Although it does the job just fine, it has a harder time holding the stink than name brand bags. I solved the issue by sticking one of the diaper genie scent absorption bags up on top of the dispenser but it still gets a bit stinky when the door’s been closed to the nursery for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for its buck
customer_reviews.text: We love these bags for our diaper genie. They are far less expensive than the name brand and works just as good if not better. The plastic is sturdier and less likely to rip, which means it can be a bit tougher to cut, but I like that. I love having these on our subscription because I would forget to order them all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I’ve been using them since the end of May. I feel like they are better than the real thing. The blue bags are heavier. I would like to have a clean sent added to the bags but I’m not gonna be picky. These don’t seem to have an added scent. But they definitely hold a load of poopy diapers. I will purchase again when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia DeSio

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would! I have never had an issue with any other brand of bags, even the other off brands. This one was AWFUL!!! It did not hold the scent well at all. After only a few messy diapers, my baby's entire nursery smelled like stinky diapers. The bags kept getting stuck, and larger portions of the bag would automatically go down ito the diaper geenie, leaving me with a small bag of diapers and about 3 feet of unused bag. Absolutley HORRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than other brands and at par with quality
customer_reviews.text: I did search for a product with good value and couldn't find a better deal. It is cheaper than other brands and I used multiple brands. Fits the diaper genie cans nicely. This one is pretty good (I mean how much can you screw up packing a plastic bag). The only reason I will continue to buy is for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Nilesh Ghadge

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't contain the smell
customer_reviews.text: I've bought off brand before (think it was Target brand) and didn't have issues but this is terrible. I might as well put the #2 diapers in the regular trash can because the diaper pail with this generic brand refill bags are NOT holding any of the smell. I've had this brand in the diaper pail for 3 days and I will not be throwing them out and running to the store to buy name brand refills. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Usable but don’t block odor
customer_reviews.text: I thought I’d save a few dollars and try these. They are not packaged like the name brand or mama bear ones. Function the same as the other bags to hold diapers and have not ripped or anything but they do not block out odor. My sons room always smells like poo now. I won’t be getting these again because of that.
customer_reviews.author: austin ung

customer_reviews.title: Work great with my Diaper Genie
customer_reviews.text: These fit fine and work as expected with the Diaper Genie. They material seems a little thinner than the OEM version, but have not had any issues with bag tearing or breaking. These bags seem just as durable. I don't know if I would say they are any better with odor control? I believe that is still reliant on the lid properly closing and replacing the charcoal filter at the manufacturer recommended intervals. The cost is what was attractive to me for this product and it did the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of bag space each time
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were not impressed by these. They weren't as good for replacing of the diaper genie brand. We found that they secure nicely so alot of wasted bag was left over each time you tried disposing these pale and refilling it. We will stick to the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: The Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value are top notch
customer_reviews.text: Great value and quality! These actually smell better than the original diaper genie refills. We have been using these continuously now for the past 6 months. They don't rip or leak. The scent is nice and we don't get a lingering odor. Wouldn't try any other brands after we found these.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Pheister

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, just buy the name brand
customer_reviews.text: These kept getting stuck in the diaper genie. When you would put a diaper in part of the refill bag would get stuck in it's container. When you opened up to fix you wasted a bunch of the bag. I ordered a 4 pack and all 4 did this! This is the first time we've bought this brand. The diaper genie name brand had never done this to us. I tried to save some money using these but ended up wasting most of the bags because of them getting stuck so I should've just bought the name brand that I know isn't such a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeany

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in how every time you put a dirty diaper in the diaper genie with these it I rolls the bag so by the time the diaper genie is full you’ve almost used up the whole thing and you have a 8 foot long bag of diapers. Would not buy again 👎🏼
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I like these bags, the blue is nice, but they don't help battle the diaper pail smell at all. I'm going back to the Munchkin brand lavender scented bags as they really help mask the smell. However, if you're really looking to save money these are the best value. They are thick, not too transparent, and you get a lot for the price.
customer_reviews.author: LuMcD

customer_reviews.title: Alright by me
customer_reviews.text: So these are almost if good as the “Name Brand” product. The only issue I found was getting it to stay in the rim indent was if feeding out everytime you add a diaper to the pail. Everytime I fill it I have about 1-2 feet of extra from it just pulling through. Didn’t have this problem with others. Over all they serve there purpose. Just gotta work with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Malone

customer_reviews.title: More Value for money and works just as well as the Playtex Brand!!
customer_reviews.text: We used this product in place of Playtex Diaper Genie Refills and I frankly notice NO DIFFERENCE WHATSOEVER in terms of performance or durability. One of the major issues we do have with the diaper genie itself is that it smells when it is filled with dirty diapers (as to be expected). However, once the bag is sealed, we rarely have an issue with the smell with either brand. So, if you are on the fence about switching to this brand, I would absolutely recommend it because you get MORE FOR YOUR MONEY AT THE SAME PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Nandini Ramanujan

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as Others
customer_reviews.text: These were cheaper than all the others I've purchased and it shows. These don't hold in the smell at all. I think the bags are too thin and flimsy and don't twist tightly closed when you put the lid down so there's a hole at the top about half inch in diameter for the smell to escape. I won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaMack

customer_reviews.title: Better than paying for the name brand
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly into our diaper genie and cost less than the name brand. However, two of them seemed like they had smaller bags in them or something because we used the same average amount of diapers but went through a refill in days compared to others lasting several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: RachtheRock

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s great. It didn’t work enough for me to consider buying it again, though. 8/10 times I pushed a diaper in it would drag the plastic down with it. I ended up tossing unused portions of plastic bags bc it kept getting sucked down.
customer_reviews.author: kara.k

product_meta.title: ChoiceRefill Compatible with Diaper Genie Pails, 4-Pack, 1080 Count
feature_bullets: Compatible with all Diaper Genie Pail System: Diaper Genie Expression, Diaper Genie Complete, Diaper Genie II Elite, Diaper Genie II, Diaper Genie Essentials and Mini

Guarantee odor control: we understand that the odor control is the first consideration when you choose a diaper pail refill. Our enhanced 7-layer smell-bloc technology helps blocking the smell to keep your home fresh.
ChoiceRefill is the most affordable refill in the market. No one can beat the price.

0 risk to try: We are so confident on the quality of our product that we extend the free return time to 90 days. If you are not absolutely satisfied with our product for any reason in the 90 days, we will refund 100% your money. Your satisfaction is guaranteed.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars7,293 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
